summary.span: Serializes and deserializes objects into and from XML documents.

span.span: Serializes and deserializes objects into and from XML documents.

summary.span: The enables you to control how objects are encoded into XML.

span.span: The enables you to control how objects are encoded into XML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks XML 序列化是将对象的公共属性和字段转换为序列格式（这里是指 XML）以便存储或传输的过程。XML serialization is the process of converting an object's public properties and fields to a serial format (in this case, XML) for storage or transport. 反序列化重新创建中的 XML 输出从其原始状态的对象。Deserialization re-creates the object in its original state from the XML output. 您可以将序列化对象的状态保存到流或缓冲区的方式。You can think of serialization as a way of saving the state of an object into a stream or buffer. 例如，ASP.NET 使用类 XML Web 服务消息进行编码。For example, ASP.NET uses the class to encode XML Web service messages. 对象中的数据是用编程语言构造来描述的，如类、字段、属性、基元类型、数组，甚至 或 对象形式的嵌入 XML。The data in your objects is described using programming language constructs like classes, fields, properties, primitive types, arrays, and even embedded XML in the form of or objects. 您可以创建您自己的类，使用属性，或使用批注[XML 架构定义工具 (Xsd.exe)](~/docs/standard/serialization/xml-schema-definition-tool-xsd-exe.md)生成基于现有 XML 架构定义 (XSD) 文档的类。You have the option of creating your own classes, annotated with attributes, or using the [XML Schema Definition Tool (Xsd.exe)](~/docs/standard/serialization/xml-schema-definition-tool-xsd-exe.md) to generate the classes based on an existing XML Schema definition (XSD) document. 如果您有一个 XML 架构，可以运行 Xsd.exe 生成一组强类型化为架构并使用要遵守架构时序列化属性批注的类。If you have an XML Schema, you can run the Xsd.exe to produce a set of classes that are strongly typed to the schema and annotated with attributes to adhere to the schema when serialized. 若要将数据传输对象和 XML 之间，需要从 XML 架构的编程语言构造和编程语言构造的 XML 架构的映射。To transfer data between objects and XML requires a mapping from the programming language constructs to XML schema and from the XML schema to the programming language constructs. 和 Xsd.exe 等相关的工具提供这两种技术在同时设计时和运行时之间的桥梁。The and related tools like Xsd.exe provide the bridge between these two technologies at both design time and runtime. 在设计时，使用 Xsd.exe 从自定义类生成 XML 架构文档 (.xsd) 或生成给定架构中的类。At design time, use the Xsd.exe to produce an XML schema document (.xsd) from your custom classes or to produce classes from a given schema. 在任一情况下，这些类进行批注和自定义特性来指示如何以 XML 架构系统和公共语言运行时之间进行映射。In either case, the classes are annotated with custom attributes to instruct the how to map between the XML schema system and the common language runtime. 在运行时，这些类的实例可以序列化为 XML 文档，请按照给定的架构。At runtime, instances of the classes can be serialized into XML documents that follow the given schema. 同样，可以将这些 XML 文档反序列化到运行时对象中。Likewise, these XML documents can be deserialized into runtime objects. 请注意，XML 架构是可选的在设计时或运行时并不是必需的。Note that the XML schema is optional, and not required at design time or runtime. ## 控制生成的 XMLControlling Generated XML 若要控制生成的 XML，可以将特殊特性应用于类和成员中。To control the generated XML, you can apply special attributes to classes and members. 例如，若要指定不同的 XML 元素名称，请应用公共字段或属性，以及组属性。For example, to specify a different XML element name, apply an to a public field or property, and set the property. 有关类似属性的完整列表，请参阅[Attributes That Control XML Serialization](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/414b820f-a696-4206-b576-2711d85490c7)。For a complete list of similar attributes, see [Attributes That Control XML Serialization](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/414b820f-a696-4206-b576-2711d85490c7). 您还可以实现界面，用于控制 XML 输出。You can also implement the interface to control the XML output. 如果生成的 XML 必须符合万维网联合会文档的第 5 节[简单对象访问协议 (SOAP) 1.1](https://www.w3.org/TR/2000/NOTE-SOAP-20000508/)，必须构造与。If the XML generated must conform to section 5 of the World Wide Consortium document, [Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) 1.1](https://www.w3.org/TR/2000/NOTE-SOAP-20000508/), you must construct the with an . 若要进一步控制编码的 SOAP XML，请使用中列出的特性[属性 That Control Encoded SOAP Serialization](~/docs/standard/serialization/attributes-that-control-encoded-soap-serialization.md)。To further control the encoded SOAP XML, use the attributes listed in [Attributes That Control Encoded SOAP Serialization](~/docs/standard/serialization/attributes-that-control-encoded-soap-serialization.md). 使用可以充分利用使用强类型化类并仍有 XML 的灵活性。With the you can take advantage of working with strongly typed classes and still have the flexibility of XML. 使用类型的字段或属性，或中强类型化的类，可以直接在 XML 对象读取 XML 文档的各个部分。Using fields or properties of type , or in your strongly typed classes, you can read parts of the XML document directly into XML objects. 如果您使用扩展的 XML 架构，还可以使用和属性进行序列化和反序列化的原始架构中找不到元素或属性。If you work with extensible XML schemas, you can also use the and attributes to serialize and deserialize elements or attributes that are not found in the original schema. 若要使用的对象，将应用返回的数组的字段对象，或将应用返回的数组的字段对象。To use the objects, apply an to a field that returns an array of objects, or apply an to a field that returns an array of objects. 如果属性或字段返回一个复杂对象（如数组或类实例），则 将其转换为嵌套在主 XML 文档内的元素。If a property or field returns a complex object (such as an array or a class instance), the converts it to an element nested within the main XML document. 例如，下面的代码中的第一个类返回第二个类的实例。For example, the first class in the following code returns an instance of the second class. ```vb Public Class MyClass Public MyObjectProperty As MyObject End Class Public Class MyObject Public ObjectName As String End Class ``` ```csharp public class MyClass { public MyObject MyObjectProperty; } public class MyObject { public string ObjectName; } ``` 序列化，XML 输出如下所示：The serialized, XML output looks like this: ``` My String ``` 如果架构包含的元素是可选的 (minOccurs ="0")，或如果该架构包含默认值，有两个选项。If a schema includes an element that is optional (minOccurs = '0'), or if the schema includes a default value, you have two options. 一种选择是使用指定默认值，如下面的代码中所示。One option is to use to specify the default value, as shown in the following code. ```vb Public Class PurchaseOrder _ Public Year As String End Class ``` ```csharp public class PurchaseOrder { [System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute ("2002")] public string Year; } ``` 另一个选项是使用特殊的模式创建识别的布尔字段，并将应用的字段。Another option is to use a special pattern to create a Boolean field recognized by the , and to apply the to the field. 中的窗体创建模式`propertyNameSpecified`。The pattern is created in the form of `propertyNameSpecified`. 例如，如果没有名为"MyFirstName"也会创建一个名为"MyFirstNameSpecified"字段的字段指示是否生成名为"MyFirstName"的 XML 元素。For example, if there is a field named "MyFirstName" you would also create a field named "MyFirstNameSpecified" that instructs the whether to generate the XML element named "MyFirstName". 这在下面的示例中显示。This is shown in the following example. ```vb Public Class OptionalOrder ' This field's value should not be serialized ' if it is uninitialized. Public FirstOrder As String ' Use the XmlIgnoreAttribute to ignore the ' special field named "FirstOrderSpecified". _ Public FirstOrderSpecified As Boolean End Class ``` ```csharp public class OptionalOrder { // This field should not be serialized // if it is uninitialized. public string FirstOrder; // Use the XmlIgnoreAttribute to ignore the // special field named "FirstOrderSpecified". [System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIgnoreAttribute] public bool FirstOrderSpecified; } ``` ## 重写默认序列化Overriding Default Serialization 你也可以通过创建一个适当的属性，并将其添加到的实例替代的序列化的对象和其字段和属性的任何一组类。You can also override the serialization of any set of objects and their fields and properties by creating one of the appropriate attributes, and adding it to an instance of the class. 重写以这种方式序列化有两个用途： 首先，您可以控制和增强的 DLL 中找到的对象的序列化，即使到源，则不能访问第二，您可以创建一组可序列化类，但序列化多个方法中的对象。Overriding serialization in this way has two uses: first, you can control and augment the serialization of objects found in a DLL, even if you do not have access to the source; second, you can create one set of serializable classes, but serialize the objects in multiple ways. 有关更多详细信息，请参阅类和[如何：控制派生类的序列化](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/caa92596-9e15-4d91-acbe-56911ef47a84)。For more details, see the class and [How to: Control Serialization of Derived Classes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/caa92596-9e15-4d91-acbe-56911ef47a84). 若要序列化对象，调用方法。To serialize an object, call the method. 若要反序列化对象，调用方法。To deserialize an object, call the method. 若要将 XML 命名空间添加到 XML 文档，请参阅。To add XML namespaces to an XML document, see . > [!NOTE] > 提供了到实现类的特殊处理方式或。The gives special treatment to classes that implement or . 实现 的类必须实现采用单个参数的公共 `Add` 方法。A class that implements must implement a public `Add` method that takes a single parameter. `Add`方法的参数必须是相同类型的返回从`Current`属性返回的值`GetEnumerator`，或该类型的基之一。The `Add` method's parameter must be of the same type as is returned from the `Current` property on the value returned from `GetEnumerator`, or one of that type's bases. 实现的类(如) 除了必须具有一个公共`Item`索引属性 （C# 中的索引器） 采用一个整数，并且它必须具有公共`Count`整数类型属性。A class that implements (such as ) in addition to must have a public `Item` indexed property (indexer in C#) that takes an integer, and it must have a public `Count` property of type integer. 参数`Add`方法必须是同一类型，从返回`Item`属性，或该类型的基之一。The parameter to the `Add` method must be the same type as is returned from the `Item` property, or one of that type's bases. 为类实现，要检索的值以进行序列化从已编制索引`Item`属性，不是通过调用`GetEnumerator`。For classes that implement , values to be serialized are retrieved from the indexed `Item` property, not by calling `GetEnumerator`. 您必须有权写入到临时目录 （如由 TEMP 环境变量所定义） 来反序列化对象。You must have permission to write to the temporary directory (as defined by the TEMP environment variable) to deserialize an object. ## 动态生成的程序集Dynamically Generated Assemblies 若要提高性能，XML 序列化基础结构动态生成要序列化和反序列化指定的类型的程序集。To increase performance, the XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates assemblies to serialize and deserialize specified types. 基础结构找到并重新使用这些程序集。The infrastructure finds and reuses those assemblies. 仅当使用以下构造函数时，会发生此行为：This behavior occurs only when using the following constructors: 如果使用任何其他构造函数，在同一程序集中的多个版本生成，并永远不会卸载，这会导致内存泄漏和性能不佳。If you use any of the other constructors, multiple versions of the same assembly are generated and never unloaded, which results in a memory leak and poor performance. 最简单的解决方案是使用前面提到的两个构造函数之一。The easiest solution is to use one of the previously mentioned two constructors. 否则，你必须缓存中的程序集，如以下示例所示。Otherwise, you must cache the assemblies in a , as shown in the following example. ```csharp Hashtable serializers = new Hashtable(); // Use the constructor that takes a type and XmlRootAttribute. XmlSerializer s = new XmlSerializer(typeof(MyClass), myRoot); // Implement a method named GenerateKey that creates unique keys // for each instance of the XmlSerializer. The code should take // into account all parameters passed to the XmlSerializer // constructor. object key = GenerateKey(typeof(MyClass), myRoot); // Check the local cache for a matching serializer. XmlSerializer ser = (XmlSerializer)serializers[key]; if (ser == null) { ser = new XmlSerializer(typeof(MyClass), myRoot); // Cache the serializer. serializers[key] = ser; } // Use the serializer to serialize or deserialize. ``` ```vb Dim serializers As New Hashtable() ' Use the constructor that takes a type and XmlRootAttribute. Dim s As New XmlSerializer(GetType([MyClass]), myRoot) ' Implement a method named GenerateKey that creates unique keys ' for each instance of the XmlSerializer. The code should take ' into account all parameters passed to the XmlSerializer ' constructor. Dim key As Object = GenerateKey(GetType([MyClass]), myRoot) ' Check the local cache for a matching serializer. Dim ser As XmlSerializer = CType(serializers(key), XmlSerializer) If ser Is Nothing Then ser = New XmlSerializer(GetType([MyClass]), myRoot) ' Cache the serializer. serializers(key) = ser End If ' Use the serializer to serialize or deserialize. ``` ## ArrayList 和泛型列表的序列化Serialization of ArrayList and Generic List 无法序列化或反序列化以下：The cannot serialize or deserialize the following: - 数组 Arrays of - 数组 Arrays of ## 无符号长整型的枚举的序列化Serialization of Enumerations of Unsigned Long 不能实例化进行序列化一个枚举，如果满足以下条件：枚举是无符号长整型 (`ulong`在C#) 和该枚举包含的值大于 9,223,372,036,854,775,807 具有任何成员。The cannot be instantiated to serialize an enumeration if the following conditions are true: The enumeration is of type unsigned long (`ulong` in C#) and the enumeration contains any member with a value larger than 9,223,372,036,854,775,807. 例如，以下无法序列化。For example, the following cannot be serialized. ``` public enum LargeNumbers: ulong { a = 9223372036854775808 } // At runtime, the following code will fail. xmlSerializer mySerializer=new XmlSerializer(typeof(LargeNumbers)); ``` ## 标记为已过时的属性不能再进行序列化的对象Objects marked with the Obsolete Attribute no longer serialized 在中[!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)]类不能再将对象标记为序列化`[Obsolete]`。In the [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] the class no longer serializes objects that are marked as `[Obsolete]`. ## Examples 下面的示例包含两个主要类：`PurchaseOrder`和`Test`。The following example contains two main classes: `PurchaseOrder` and `Test`. `PurchaseOrder`类包含有关单个的采购信息。The `PurchaseOrder` class contains information about a single purchase. `Test`类包含创建采购订单，并读取创建的采购订单的方法。The `Test` class contains the methods that create the purchase order, and that read the created purchase order. [!code-cpp[Classic XmlSerializer Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic XmlSerializer Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic XmlSerializer Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic XmlSerializer Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic XmlSerializer Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic XmlSerializer Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常情况下，应用程序定义了多个类的转换为单个 XML 实例文档。Commonly, an application defines several classes that the converts into a single XML-instance document. 但是，必须知道只有一种类型-该类表示 XML 根元素的类型。However, the must know only one type--the type of the class that represents the XML root element. 自动序列化所有从属类的实例。The automatically serializes all subordinate class instances. 同样，仅 XML 根元素的类型是必需的反序列化。Similarly, only the type of the XML root element is required for deserialization. ## Examples 下面的示例构造的名为将对象序列化为`Widget`。The following example constructs an that serializes an object named `Widget`. 该示例设置之前，调用对象的各种属性方法。The example sets various properties of the object before calling the method. [!code-cpp[Classic XmlSerializer.XmlSerializer6 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic XmlSerializer.XmlSerializer6 Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic XmlSerializer.XmlSerializer6 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic XmlSerializer.XmlSerializer6 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic XmlSerializer.XmlSerializer6 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic XmlSerializer.XmlSerializer6 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此构造函数用于创建将对象序列化为 SOAP 消息。This constructor is used to create an when you serialize an object into a SOAP message. 若要控制生成的 SOAP 消息，请使用在中找到的特殊属性 （以单词"Soap"开头）命名空间。To control the SOAP messages generated, use the special attributes (beginning with the word "Soap") found in the namespace. ## Examples 下面的示例序列化类名为`Group`。The following example serializes a class named `Group`. 序列化`GroupName`，`IgnoreThis`字段和的成员`GroupType`枚举将被重写。The serialization of the `GroupName`, `IgnoreThis` fields, and the members of the `GroupType` enumeration are overridden. 在中`CreateOverrideSerializer`方法，对象已创建，并为每个重写的成员或枚举、 一个对象创建相应的属性设置，并添加到对象。In the `CreateOverrideSerializer` method, a object is created, and for each overridden member or enumeration, a object is created with the appropriate property set and added to the object. 对象使用创建对象，并且对象用于创建的重写默认序列化。An object is created using the object, and that object is used to create the that overrides the default serialization. [!code-cpp[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapAttributesOverrides/CPP/soapover.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapAttributesOverrides/CS/soapover.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapAttributesOverrides/VB/SoapOver.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，如果公共属性或字段返回一个对象或对象的数组的对象类型将自动序列化。By default, if a public property or field returns an object, or array of objects, the object types are automatically serialized. 但是，如果类包含的字段或属性的返回类型的数组，可以将任何对象插入该数组。However, if a class contains a field or property that returns an array of type , any object can be inserted into that array. 在这种情况下，预期插入到的所有可能的对象类型，必须指示数组。In that case, the must be instructed to expect all the possible object types that are inserted into the array. 若要执行此操作，请使用`extraTypes`参数来指定要序列化或反序列化的额外的对象类型。To do this, use the `extraTypes` parameter to specify the extra object types to serialize or deserialize. 此外可以使用`extraTypes`参数来指定类型派生自的基类。You can also use the `extraTypes` parameter to specify types derived from a base class. 例如，假设名为的基类`Phone`存在，和一个名为类`InternationalPhone`从其派生。For example, suppose a base class named `Phone` exists, and a class named `InternationalPhone` derives from it. 使用`extraTypes`参数来指定派生的类型。Use the `extraTypes` parameter to specify the derived type as well. ## Examples 下面的示例序列化包含返回的对象数组的公共字段的类的实例。The following example serializes an instance of a class that contains a public field that returns an array of objects. `extraTypes`参数的构造函数指定数组中的可序列化的对象的类型。The `extraTypes` parameter of the constructor specifies the types of the objects that can be serialized in the array. remarks.format: ## Remarks `overrides`参数可用于控制如何在 XML 中编码的字段和属性。The `overrides` parameter can be used to control how fields and properties are encoded in XML. 这些设置将覆盖已存在的对象上的任何属性。These settings override any attributes that already exist on the objects. 不能修改的源代码或多个编码所需的相同的类时，这很有用。This can be useful when the source code cannot be modified or multiple encodings are required for the same classes. ## Examples 下面的示例序列化在 DLL 中，并为此定义，将替代在 DLL 中找到的公共成员的类的实例。The following example serializes an instance of a class that is defined in a DLL and to do so, overrides the public members found in the DLL. remarks.format: ## Remarks XML 文档的根元素包含所有其他元素。The root element of an XML document encloses all the other elements. 默认情况下，该对象指定`type`参数序列化为根元素。By default, the object specified by the `type` parameter is serialized as the root element. 属性，例如根元素的 XML 元素名称取自`type`对象。Properties, such as the XML element name of the root element, are taken from the `type` object. 但是，`root`参数，可通过指定替换默认对象的信息; 该对象可以设置不同的命名空间、 元素名称等。However, the `root` parameter allows you to replace the default object's information by specifying an ; the object allows you to set a different namespace, element name, and so on. ## Examples 下面的示例构造，它使用包含各种属性的 XML 根元素，例如其命名空间和元素名称。The following example constructs an that uses an that contains various properties of the XML root element, such as its namespace and element name. XML 文档的根元素包含所有其他元素。The root element of an XML document encloses all the other elements. 默认情况下，该对象指定`type`参数序列化为根元素。By default, the object specified by the `type` parameter is serialized as the root element. 属性，例如根元素的 XML 元素名称取自`type`对象。Properties, such as the XML element name of the root element are taken from the `type` object. 但是，`root`参数，可通过指定替换默认对象的信息 [XmlSerializer 构造函数 (Type，XmlAttributeOverrides，类型\;对象可以设置不同的命名空间、 元素名称等。However, the `root` parameter allows you to replace the default object's information by specifying an [XmlSerializer Constructor (Type, XmlAttributeOverrides, Type\; the object allows you to set a different namespace, element name, and so on. 使用`defaultName`参数来指定生成的所有 XML 元素的默认命名空间 [XmlSerializer 构造函数 (Type，XmlAttributeOverrides，类型\。Use the `defaultName` parameter to specify the default namespace of all XML elements generated by the [XmlSerializer Constructor (Type, XmlAttributeOverrides, Type\. ## Examples 下面的示例序列化定义了在 DLL 中，若要执行此操作，重写在类中找到的公共成员的类的实例。The following example serializes an instance of a class that is defined in a DLL and to do so, overrides the public members found in the class. 该示例还指定额外的类型、 所有 XML 元素，并要使用提供的 XML 根元素信息的类的默认命名空间数组。The example also specifies an array of extra types, the default namespace for all XML elements, and the class to use that provides the XML root element information. 该示例假定在开头的代码已被编译到名为的 DLL `HighSchool`。The example assumes that the code at the beginning has been compiled into a DLL named `HighSchool`. remarks.format: ## Remarks 反序列化是将 XML 文档并构造强类型化到 XML 架构 (XSD) 文档的一个对象的过程。Deserialization is the process of reading an XML document and constructing an object that is strongly typed to the XML Schema (XSD) of the document. 反序列化之前,必须使用要反序列化的对象的类型构造。Before deserializing, an must be constructed using the type of the object that is being deserialized. 使用`stream`参数来指定从派生的对象类，该类用于写入流。Use the `stream` parameter to specify an object that derives from the class, which is designed to write to streams. 派生的类类包括：Classes that derive from the class include: - - - - - > [!NOTE] > 无法反序列化以下： 数组和数组。The cannot deserialize the following: arrays of and arrays of . ## Examples 下面的示例进行反序列化对象使用对象。The following example deserializes an object using a object. remarks.format: ## Remarks 当调用方法、 公共字段和读/写属性的对象转换为 XML。When the method is invoked, the public fields and read/write properties of an object are converted into XML. 方法、 索引器、 私有字段和只读属性不会序列化。Methods, indexers, private fields, and read-only properties are not serialized. 若要序列化所有字段和属性，包括公共和私有，使用。To serialize all fields and properties, both public and private, use the . 使用`stream`参数来指定从抽象派生的对象类，该类用于写入流。Use the `stream` parameter to specify an object that derives from the abstract class, which is designed to write to streams. 派生的类类包括：Classes that derive from the class include: - - - - - > [!NOTE] > 无法序列化以下： 数组和数组。The cannot serialize the following: arrays of and arrays of . ## Examples 下面的示例通过将对象序列化为对象。The following example serializes an object with a object. 此示例还创建并将两个命名空间添加到该对象。The example also creates an and adds two namespaces to the object. 定义序列化的对象的类还具有特性来指定每个元素的命名空间。The class that defines the serialized object is also attributed with attributes to specify the namespace for each element. remarks.format: ## Remarks *Id*参数提供用于创建 SOAP id 的基本字符串。The *id* parameter supplies the base string used to create SOAP ids. 默认情况下，它们是"id1"、"id2"等。By default, these are "id1", "id2" and so on. 但如果该参数设置为"myBase"生成的值是"myBaseid1"，"myBaseid2"，依此类推。But if the parameter is set to "myBase" the generated values are "myBaseid1", "myBaseid2" and so on. 此功能用于跨整个 SOAP 消息创建唯一 id 值。This functionality is used to create unique id values across the whole SOAP message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，在调用方法，将忽略未知类型的 XML 属性。By default, after calling the method, the ignores XML attributes of unknown types. 但是，可以使用此事件来处理此类节点类型。However, you can use this event to handle such node types. 如果正在反序列化类的实例包含返回的数组的字段对象和一个已应用到字段，事件不会发生。If the instance of the class being deserialized contains a field that returns an array of objects and an has been applied to the field, the event does not occur. 相反，所有未知的 XML 特性将收集到数组。Instead, all unknown XML attributes are collected into the array. ## Examples 以下示例输出有关反序列化的 XML 文档时遇到任何未知属性的信息。The following example prints information about any unknown attributes encountered while deserializing an XML document. [!code-cpp[Classic XmlSerializer.UnknownAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic XmlSerializer.UnknownAttribute Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic XmlSerializer.UnknownAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic XmlSerializer.UnknownAttribute Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic XmlSerializer.UnknownAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic XmlSerializer.UnknownAttribute Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，在调用方法，将忽略未知类型的 XML 属性。By default, after calling the method, the ignores XML attributes of unknown types. 但是，可以使用此事件来处理此类节点类型。However, you can use this event to handle such node types. > [!NOTE] > 如果应用于返回的数组的字段对象时，所有的未知的元素收集到数组中。If the is applied to a field that returns an array of objects, all unknown elements are collected in the array. 在这种情况下，事件不会发生。In that case, the event does not occur. ## Examples 下面的示例进行反序列化的类名为`Group`从名为 UnknownElements.xml 的文件。The following example deserializes a class named `Group` from a file named UnknownElements.xml. 只要不具备对应成员在类中，在文件中找到的元素事件发生。Whenever an element is found in the file that has no corresponding member in the class, the event occurs. 若要试用示例，请将以下 XML 代码粘贴到名为 UnknownElements.xml 的文件。To try the example, paste the following XML code into a file named UnknownElements.xml. ``` MyGroup Large 444 West ``` [!code-cpp[XmlSerializer.UnknownElement Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/XmlSerializer.UnknownElement Example/CPP/unknownelement.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlSerializer.UnknownElement Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/XmlSerializer.UnknownElement Example/CS/unknownelement.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlSerializer.UnknownElement Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/XmlSerializer.UnknownElement Example/VB/unknownelement.vb#1)]

summary.span: Occurs during deserialization of a SOAP-encoded XML stream, when the encounters a recognized type that is not used or is unreferenced.

span.span: Occurs during deserialization of a SOAP-encoded XML stream, when the encounters a recognized type that is not used or is unreferenced.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 才会发生事件时用于反序列化包含符合万维网联合会文档的第 5 节的 SOAP 消息的 XML 文档[简单对象访问协议 (SOAP) 1.1](https://www.w3.org/TR/2000/NOTE-SOAP-20000508/).The event only occurs when the is used to deserialize an XML document that contains a SOAP message that conforms to section 5 of the World Wide Web Consortium document, [Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) 1.1](https://www.w3.org/TR/2000/NOTE-SOAP-20000508/). 符合第 5 节的文档是一种特殊格式。Documents that conform to section 5 are in a special format. 最起码，此类文档包含 SOAP 消息的主要部分。At the very least, such a document includes the main body of the SOAP message. 但是，而不是所有类型以内联方式定义文档中，某些类型定义可被编码为对文档中的顶级元素的引用。However, rather than having all types defined inline in the document, some type definitions can be encoded as references to top-level elements in the document. 因此，对于为引用的主体中找到每个元素，必须有一个包含类型定义的相应元素。Thus, for every element found in the main body that is a reference, there must be a corresponding element that contains the type definition. 若要关联的引用元素和类型定义，该类型定义了`id`属性设置为一个唯一字符串 ID 和引用的元素具有`href`属性引用相同的 id。To correlate the referencing element and the type definition, the type definition has an `id` attribute set to a unique string ID and the referencing element has an `href` attribute that references the same ID. ``` 10000 1234 ``` 事件发生时在文档中找到的类型定义但没有参数的主要部分中引用它。The event occur when there is a type definition found in the document, but no parameter in the main body references it. 事件发生时，可以通过检查来检索未引用的对象的 XML 类型属性的类。When the event occurs, you can retrieve the XML type of the unreferenced object by examining the property of the class. 返回对象的 XML ID属性。The XML ID of the object is returned by the property. 事件不应与混淆和没有对应的 XML 节点或元素类型的类成员时，可能发生的事件。The event should not be confused with the and events, which occur when there is no class member that corresponds to the XML node or element type. ## Examples 以下示例将添加到。The following example adds an to an . 事件由处理`Serializer``_``UnreferencedObject`方法。The event is handled by the `Serializer``_``UnreferencedObject` method. 若要运行该示例，剪切并粘贴到文件中名为"UnrefObj.xml"下面的 XML。To run the example, cut and paste the following XML into a file named "UnrefObj.xml". ``` ABCD 1234 ``` [!code-cpp[UnreferencedObject Event Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/UnreferencedObject Event Example/CPP/unrefobj.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[UnreferencedObject Event Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/UnreferencedObject Event Example/CS/unrefobj.cs#1)] [!code-vb[UnreferencedObject Event Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/UnreferencedObject Event Example/VB/unrefobj.vb#1)]
